ArticleTitle.sentence: Human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 tax protein abrogates interleukin-2 dependence in a mouse T-cell line.

event.clue: Human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 tax protein abrogates interleukin-2 dependence in a mouse T-cell line.

AbstractText.sentence: Human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 (HTLV-1) is the etiologic agent of adult T-cell leukemia.

event.clue: Human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 (HTLV-1) is the etiologic agent of adult T-cell leukemia.

AbstractText.sentence: Tax, the viral protein, is thought to be crucial in the development of the disease, since it transforms healthy T cells in vitro and induces tumors in transgenic animals.

AbstractText.sentence: We examined the effect of Tax activity on the growth of the interleukin-2 (IL-2)-dependent T-cell line CTLL-2.

event.clue: We examined the effect of Tax activity on the growth of the interleukin-2 (IL-2)-dependent T-cell line CTLL-2.

AbstractText.sentence: Stable expression of Tax in CTLL-2 transformed cell growth from being IL-2 dependent to IL-2 independent.

AbstractText.sentence: The finding of Tax mutants segregating these two pathways suggested that the NF-kappaB pathway was essential for IL-2-independent growth of CTLL-2 cells while the CRE pathway was unnecessary.

AbstractText.sentence: Our results show that Tax has at least two distinct activities on T cells, and suggest that Tax plays a crucial role in IL-2-independent T-cell transformation induced by HTLV-1, in addition to its well-known IL-2-dependent cell transformation.
